Base Pay.message: There is a discrepancy with Base Pay. This is often attributed to a change in grade or years of service that occured during the month. However, it can sometimes be due to an inaccurate Pay Entry Base Date (PEBD) which is used to calculate years of service.

BAS.message: There is a discrepancy with the BAS. This can occur if you have changed from BAS rate I to rate II or vice versa. Please verify your current BAS rate to ensure accuracy.

BAH.message: There is a discrepancy with the BAH. This may be due to recent changes in locality rates. Please verify that the zip code used to determine your BAH rate is correct in addition to the number of dependents you have claimed. Contact your personnel office if you need to update your number of dependents.

Federal Taxes.message: There is a discrepancy with Federal Taxes. This may be due to a mismatch between the variables which calculate federal taxes such as filing status, number of dependents, and additional withholdings.

FICA - Social Security.message: There is a discrepancy with FICA - Social Security. This may be due to a difference in base pay between what you currently earned versus what you were expected to earn according to your pay grade and years of service.

FICA - Medicare.message: There is a discrepancy with FICA - Medicare. This may be due to a difference in base pay between what you currently earned versus what you were expected to earn according to your pay grade and years of service.

SGLI Rate.message: There is a discrepancy with the SGLI Rate. Please ensure that your SGLI coverage amount is correct by checking the official SGLI chart to your  SGLI coverage selection in milConnect.

State Taxes.message: There is a discrepancy with State Taxes. Each state has its own tax rates and rules, so please verify your state's tax information for accuracy.
